page.title: 02Playground games in Whitley
page.content: The{playground }at Whitley school is by the side of Village Lane. A member of staff is always on duty keeping a watchful eye over us all. One of the most popular games is football which is played by the boys most of the time. At lunch time break there are 2 dinner ladies in the playground. They help children who fall over. In the winter we make igloos, skid patches, snowmen,snowbears and other animals. NO SNOWBALLS are allowed. Inside, we play board games, noughts & crosses, donkey kong, read or play games on the computer. In the summer we play tick, skipping & climbing on the frame. The girls often play horses or swing on small bars. Infants play families in the old front porch. There is a garden with sandpit and climbing frame for fine weather and a playing field where we can play cricket or anything else.
